title: [Self-Directed] Short-Intensive Course on H∞ Controller Design Based on Reinforcement Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational control theory and linear systems understanding, with basic Python programming skills
context.additional_context: A course delivering core concepts of H∞ control theory and reinforcement learning-based design methods to practitioners, enhancing real-world system application skills through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Explain the mathematical principles of GARE (Game Algebraic Riccati Equation) and their connection to H∞ control.
Understand and implement the operational principles of minimax Q-learning based on offline policy iteration algorithms.
Perform simple H∞ controller design simulations using only smartphone-based tools in limited technological environments.

resources: Open-Source Reinforcement Learning Library (TensorFlow Lite, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
